english_translation: Narrated by Aisha: When the Messenger of Allah ﷺ arrived in Madinah, Abu Bakr and Bilal became ill with fever. I entered upon them and said: O father, how do you find yourself? And O Bilal, how do you find yourself? Abu Bakr, when fever seized him, would say: Every man is with his family in the morning, and death is nearer than the strap of his sandal. And Bilal, when the fever abated, would raise his voice and say: Oh would that I knew - shall I spend a night in a wadi with idhkir and jalil around me? And shall I come upon the waters of Majannah? And shall Shama and Tafil appear before me? Aisha said: So I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and informed him, and he said: O Allah, make Madinah beloved to us as we love Makkah, cure it, bless us in its sa and mudd, and remove its fever and place it in al-Juhfah. Al-Rabi said: al-Jalil is a plant. al-Aqirah is the voice. Shama and Tafil are two mountains overlooking Majannah. Majannah is a market at the bottom of Makkah at the distance of a bridle. Abu Ubaidah, from Jabir ibn Zayd, said: I heard Jabir ibn Abdullah saying: A Bedouin pledged allegiance to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and the Bedouin was seized with malaise. The hadith. Al-Rabi from Ubadah ibn as-Samit said: Indeed the Messenger of Allah ﷺ was treated by Gabriel while he had malaise. The hadith.

english_translation: Narrated by Jabir: It reached me from a companion of the Prophet ﷺ who came to the Prophet ﷺ complaining to him of the severity of pain, so the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to him: Wipe with your right hand seven times and say: I seek refuge in the mighty power of Allah and His might from the evil of what I find. He said: So I did that and Allah removed from me what was upon me, and I continued commanding it to my family and others. And from the path of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: No calamity strikes a believer except that Allah expiates his sins through it, even a thorn.

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: A man from Aslam said: I did not sleep the night. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: From what? He said: A scorpion bit me. So he said, may peace be upon him: If you had said when you became evening: I seek refuge in the complete words of Allah the Mighty and Exalted from the evil of what He has created, nothing would have harmed you, if Allah wills. Abu Ubaidah said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ encouraged the visiting of relatives and the visiting of the sick, and he said: Had you known what good is in them, you would not have stayed away from them. And Allah writes with each step from that ten good deeds.
